data.title: Glenmarc Antonio on LinkedIn: With Ron Artest / Metta World Peace / Metta Sandiford
data.meta_description: With Ron Artest / Metta World Peace / Metta Sandiford-Artest, the NBA's 2003-04 Defensive Player of the Year (Indiana Pacers) and 2010 NBA champion (Losâ€¦
data.text:
With Justine Baltazar, #1 overall draft pick in the 2024 PBA Season 49 Draft selected by Converge. He played professionally for the Pampanga Giant Lanterns of the Maharlika Pilipinas Basketball League (MPBL), winning two championships for the franchise - one each in both the MPBL and Pilipinas Super League (PSL). He played for the Philippine national team in the 2022 FIBA Asia Cup qualifiers and the 2020 FIBA Olympic Qualifying Tournament (mid-2021). In 2022, he signed with the Hiroshima Dragonflies of the B.League (Japanese basketball league). Later in 2023 and 2024, he was part of the Strong Group team that played in the Dubai International Basketball Championship. During his college years, he suited up for the De La Salle Green Archers and was selected to three UAAP Mythical Teams. Thanks for the photo, Justine! Photo taken back in 2023 during Strong Group's preparations for their Dubai tilt. #JustineBaltazar

With NBA champion (2006) and Hall of Famer (Class of 2014) Alonzo Mourning. He is currently the Vice President of Player Programs and Development for the NBA's Miami Heat. He is 7x NBA All Star, was named to the All-NBA First Team (1999), a 2x NBA Defensive Player of the Year and is also a 2x NBA blocks leader. His jersey #33 has been retired by the Miami Heat. He also played for the Charlotte Hornets (No.2 overall pick of the 1992 NBA Draft) and the New Jersey Nets.

With Japanese basketball legend Takehiko Orimo, one of the best sharpshooters ever from Asia. He is the first player to reach 10,000 points in the history of Japanese professional hoops. - 2002 Japan Basketball League (JBL) Most Valuable Player (MVP) - Two-time JBL Best Five member - Two-time JBL All-Star MVP - Won championships with Toyota (2001, 2005, 2006) - FIBA World Cup (1998, 2006) - FIBA Asia Cup (2007, 2009) He is now the President of Levanga Hokkaido of the Japanese B.League where Gilas Pilipinas star Dwight Ramos is currently playing. Photo taken during FIBA WC Draw weekend (April 28, 2023).

With Oscar Kao, the star player and captain of the Hsinchu Toplus Lioneers from the P. LEAGUE+ (Taiwanese pro basketball tournament). He recently recorded 1,000 career points and was the 2020-21 PLG Rookie of the Year. Oscar is one of the best guards in the entire league, and is also one of the highest paid players in Taiwan's pro basketball history. He was previously named to the All-PLG 2nd Team and the PLG All-Defensive Team. Photo taken during my BC Wolves work visit to Hsinchu County, Taiwan (May 13, 2023). #PoundTheRock #LioneersRespect #HsinchuLioneers #OscarKao

With Iranian basketball legend Hamed Haddadi, former NBA player (Memphis Grizzlies, Phoenix Suns) and long-time tormentor of Gilas Pilipinas during his stint playing in Asia. As member of the Iranian senior national basketball team since 2004, he has won multiple medals in the Asian Games (two silvers and one bronze), FIBA Asia Cup (gold medalist - 2007, 2009, 2013), FIBA Asia Challenge (gold medalist 2014 and 2016), and William Jones Cup (gold medalist - 2009, 2011, 2013, 2015). He has also won multiple MVP awards (4x Asian Cup), FIBA Asia Challenge (2014), William Jones Cup (2013), and Chinese Basketball Association / CBA (Finals MVP 2016). Photo taken during FIBA WC Draw weekend (April 28, 2023).

The first batch of BC Wolves season tickets for the upcoming season have sold out. "Sales for Wolves Twinsbet season tickets for the upcoming season began last Wednesday, May 1st, and basketball fans immediately seized the opportunity. The first 300 season tickets were swiftly sold out at unbeatable prices. All season ticket holders will save between 40% to 70% off the retail price compared to individual home game ticket prices throughout the season. Season tickets will be available for purchase via Bilietai.lt, both online and at the company's ticket offices for fans' convenience." https://lnkd.in/grGRX9Yj #BCWolves #WolvesTwinsbet #WeAreWolves

With Montenegrin basketball legend Nikola Pekovic, former NBA player (Minnesota Timberwolves) and currently the President of the Basketball Federation of Montenegro. He is a EuroLeague champion (2009, Panathinaikos) and was awarded All-EuroLeague First Team (2009) & Second Team (2008). He won a Greek Cup championship (2009) and Serbian Cup (2008). In the NBA, he spent seven years with the Timberwolves (2010-2017). He also represented the Montenegrin Men's National Team at the 2011 EuroBasket. . . . Photo taken during 2023 FIBA WC Naismith Trophy Tour (August 20, 2023).
